TopicTitle: How did you find the game?

Articles.Content: saw it on steam as an early access thing but didn't really think it was worth looking at. than after a while and it still being on the front page I figured "well it must be good to be up here for this long" so I decided to try the demo and was instantly hooked and than bought the full version even though I usually wait for sales, though I felt better knowing that I had supported the devs more. now I'm an amature rocket builder and pilot and have just landed on the mun a few minutes ago (probably would have gotten there sooner if I didn't try to land on duna first, damn planet orbits )

*My first post yay*

Buddy of mine was playing it in the barracks during annual training this summer, I was hooked from that second. I have yet to play the game by myself but as soon as my new Lenovo Y510p gets here KSP will be the first game on it!!
In July of 2011, about a month after KSP's public release, someone called 'BarryDennen12' made a video on it. Instantly downloaded it. Always been playing it since.
Back in the summer of 2012 I literally Googled "list of space flight simulator games" and checked out a bunch of the games on THIS list. One of them happens to be KSP and I haven't looked back.
From Steam featured items. Had never heard of it before. Immediately addicted.
From a magazine which talk about the demo (the old 0.13.3) and how to build our first rocket. I download the demo and bought the game few days after.
about July 2012 I searched "air races" on youtube and somebody's post for an air racing challenge came up.

I found it from Robbaz's videos(dude is hilarious). I found a video of his Surgeon Simulator video on the internet, and after I recovered from all the laughing(I almost died watching that video it was so funny), I watched his other shows, KSP included. After a couple of shows watching him have that much fun with the game, I figured I'd give it a shot.

Best money I've ever spent on a game.

I had heard people talk about it in the Beamng forums but never really looked into it. One day someone said something about it in some thread and I had nothing else to do, so I googled it and downloaded the demo. That was back in march. I didn't join the forums till April and got the game in early may. I'm completely hooked now.

Edited June 20, 2013 by rustylugnut

I don't know if there is a thread like this, but how did you find the game?

I found it with Nerd3's Free Games!

Same with me.

First saw it on the Natural Selection 2 forums, but it didn't really catch my interest until I saw it on Jesse Cox's Fan friday video. And subsequently found scott manly, HOC, and kurtjmac, got demo and here I am now.

I was surfing the "Free Allegiance" forums, (GO CHECK IT OUT NAO) when I saw a post about this. I thought "Woohoo this looks like its free and will run on my PC easily!

(back then I had crap PC)

I then tryed the laggy demo, bought it because I thought I needed a plugin for C7 Wheels.
I met Felipe at a party in San Jose and he slipped a thumb drive at me and said "this game is going to change the world"

I watch a lot of 'quick looks' on giantbomb.com (basically gameplay vids). One of the ones they did about a year ago was KSP, and honestly not only did the game interest me, but it was one of the funniest quick looks they had done up to that point.

I saw a random dude launching rockets into space on his laptop while at a friend's. This then prompted me to spend 2 days on Google with searches like "Green dude rocket game" and "Green astronaut rocket sim" and so on until I found the KSP website!
I accidently hit "All" on reddit a couple times, and posts from the KSP subreddit kept showing up so I checked it out.
I saw a post on the Minecraft forums about KSP a few years ago, so I took a look at it.
I would never have found this game if it wasn't for Steam. A couple of hours playing the Demo and I was hooked. Bought the game same day.
I saw a video on youtube back in .13 ... It wasn't really interesting enough to buy it then to me but i ended up buying it in .17

I saw the mouseover text on this xkcd, was curious, and asked a few people about it. It seemed interesting, so I downloaded the demo, and about 30 minutes later bought the game. (Actually, it's the only game I've ever bought; all the other games I've played were either free or belonged to friends.)
I actually found this game through markiplier then kurtjmac and then scott manley.
I was watching Kurtjmac do his 'Far Lands or Bust' series and saw that he played KSP. I was instantly hooked to the game, and subscribed to Kurt.

I found it on a whim during a browse of the FyreUK minecraft forums.

Glad I'm not the only one!

I first encountered it via an EVE-related blog. Thought "must keep an eye on that". Duly did so. At some juncture I downloaded the demo on Steam, played around and discovered I found it fun. Then persuaded my better half it would be a good birthday present.

The whole story. My mom say an article in a magazine for an online outdoor game called geocaching. This led to a guy with the username of "Falcon Loader" who suggested that I may be interested in the Civil Air Patrol. That led me to a flying activity with them. A few months latter, a guy I was there with posted a link to the website on face book. I saw it, thought it was interesting, and I've been hooked ever since.
